or

or

parameters.name: poolPath
parameters.description:
Name of parent pool or Hierarchical path to the parent pool if parent pool name is not unique enough.
 If poolInfo is uuid, we don't need this parameter

There is more than one address pool named <pool>.  Parent pool name is required.

Unable to delete V6 Pool - <pool> containing child pools or blocks

get.description: Check the status of a DNS or DHCP generation using a token from the DNS or DHCP Generation response.

parameters.name: Authentication
parameters.description:
Token tokenValue
or
Basic username:password
or
Leave blank if using Client Certificate Authentication

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Token of the job you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: extension
parameters.description:
.json for a response in JSON format.
.xml for a response in XML format.

500.description: Internal Error.  Please contact System Administrator. Last unit does not have enough valid bits

get.description: Use this URL to download DNS and DHCP server configuration files. When using cURL with this API specify "-o fileName.extension" to download file contents. Internet Explorer browser users: to download the report please right click the Download file link and select Save as then input the desired file name with the correct extension.

parameters.name: Authentication
parameters.description:
Token tokenValue
or
Basic username:password
or
Leave blank if using Client Certificate Authentication

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Token of the server generation job.

parameters.name: files
parameters.description: Name of individual file(s)s to be downloaded. Multiple files names must be separated by a comma (,). All available files are downloaded if this field is not specified. This field is not required.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: File compression type. Either "zip" or "gzip". This field is not required.

400.description: Invalid value: [<token>]

404.description:
Could not find job: [<token>]

File doesn't exist

expires.description:
The token expiration time, in seconds. 
Default to expireTime (default 86400 seconds) if not set. Expiration time cannot exceed value of maxExpireTime (default 7776000 seconds) property. 
Both expireTime and maxExpireTime are configured in qip.properties file.

owner.description: Owner name for the resource record.

classType.description: Class type of records pertains to a type of network or software.

data1.description: The data associated with the specific resource record type.

ttl.description: The length of time (in seconds) the name server will hold this information. If no TTL is defined, the value is inherited from the zone.

data2.description: The data associated with the specific resource record type.

data3.description: The data associated with the specific resource record type.

data4.description: The data associated with the specific resource record type.

isCreatingReverseZoneRR.description: When creating or updating PTR resource record in Object/Node level, if this property is set to true, the PTR resource record will be created in Reverse zone. Otherwise, resource record will be created in Object as normally. Default value of this property is false. This property will be hidden when users get resource record.

isDefaultRR.description: This is read only field, true if the resource record is default resource record, otherwise false.

maskLength.description: Mask length of v4 network. This field is required when create, but must not be changed when modify

email.description: email to contact. This field is required when create, but must not be changed when modify

dnsServer.description: Name of DNS Server. This field is required when create, but must not be changed when modify

cidr.description: CIDR (Y or N). This field is required when create, but must not be changed when modify

V6DefaultAlgorithmType.description: depend on using Algorithm value for createSubnet

subnetName.description: depend on using Specific value for createSubnet

subnetAddress.description: depend on using Specific value for createSubnet

subnetsNo.description: depend on using Algorithm value for createSubnet. That is the number of subnet will be created by 1 request

objectAddr.description: The hostname of the object. Not fully-qualified.

objectClass.description: ObjectClass is a value of  Workstation, X-terminal, PC, Printer, Server, Wiring_HUB, Router, Bridge, Terminal_Server, Switch, Legacy_System, Gateway, Test_Equipment, Undefined, Others, Any user-defined object class name.

domainName.description: The domain of the object. If no value is provided, the Domain Name is identified as the default domain of the subnet the Object is on.

expiredDate.description: The date when a reserved object expires and is no longer reserved.

serverType.description: Only applicable if ObjectClass is 'server': TimeServer- If object is a time server, TftpServer- If object is a Tftp server, TftpServer\&TimeServer- If object is a TftpServer and TimeServer.

purchaseDate.description: Purchase Date/Time of object. Must be in yyyy-mm-dd format

locationId.description: The Location ID. If no Location ID is specified, an attempt is made to match the record EXACTLY with the Street1, Street2, City, State, Zip and/or Country information that is supplied. If a match is not found, a new record is added without an ID.

contactId.description: The Contact ID. If no Contact ID is specified, an attempt is made to match the record EXACTLY with the ContactLastName and ContactFirstName information that is supplied. If no match is found, a new record is added without an ID.

routerGroup.description: Router Group of object. Only applicable if the object class is "router".

dynamicConfig.description: Dynamic Configuration of Object include Blank - Static object, None- Dynamic (none), M-DHCP- Manual DHCP, A-DHCP- Automatic DHCP, D-DHCP- Dynamic DHCP, M-BOOTP- Manual Bootp,  A-BOOTP- Automatic Bootp, Reserved - To reserve an object (the IP must be unused)

macAddr.description: The Mac Address of Object. Exclude the colons (:) when entering a MAC address.

tftpServer.description: TFTP Server of object. Only applicable if object type is M-BOOTP.

bootFileName.description: Bootfile name of object. Only applicable if object type is MBOOTP.

hardwareType.description: NONE, ETHERNET, TOKEN_RING, AX25, PRONET, CHAOS, IEEE802, ARCNET.

dnsServers.description: DNS Servers attached to this object. If multiple, separate by space. Only applicable for M-BOOTP objects.

timeServers.description: Time Servers attached to this object. If multiple, separate by space. Only applicable for M-BOOTP objects.

defaultRouters.description: IP Address(es) of Default routers, separated by space if multiples.

userClasses.description: Specific categories of user options. To enter one or more user classes for this object, enclose a list of users in double quotes (for example, user1, user2, user3).

nameService.description:
Name Services selection:
- No: Name Services checked off.
- Yes: Name Services checked on.
- A: Name Services checked on, A record checked on.
- PTR: Name Services checked on, PTR record checked on.
- A PTR: Name Services checked on, A record checked on, PTR record checked on.

dynamicDnsUpdate.description:
Dynamic Update selection:
  - A- Dynamic updates for A records.
  - PTR- Dynamic updates for PTR records.
  - CNAME- Dynamic updates for CNAME records.
  - MX- Dynamic updates for MX records.

dhcpServer.description: The DHCP Server assigned to this object. Only applicable for dynamic objects.

dhcpOptionTemplate.description: The DHCP Option Template assigned to this object. Only applicable for dynamic objects.

dhcpPolicyTemplate.description: The DHCP Policy template assigned to this object. Only applicable for dynamic objects.

leaseTime.description: The lease time (in seconds assigned) to this object. Only applicable for dynamic objects.

ttlTime.description: Time to live (TTL) value, in seconds. Since 0 is a valid value, a value of-1 indicates no TTL set.

vendorClass.description: The Vendor Class assigned to this object. Only applicable for dynamic objects.

clientId.description: The unique value assigned to DHCP client.

decNetArea.description: DECNet Area. (Valid values are 1-63) Only applicable if Dual Protocol is set to DECNet. The DECNet Address is calculated on the input in the DECNetArea and the DECNet Node.

decNetAddr.description: DECNet Address. (Valid values are 1-1024) Only applicable if Dual Protocol set to DECNet. The DECNet Address is calculated on the input in the DECNetArea and the DECNet Node.

ipxNode.description: IPX Node. Only applicable if Dual Protocol is set to IPX.

ipxNetworkNumber.description: IPX Network number. Only applicable if Dual Protocol is set to IPX.

netBiosDomain.description: NetBIOS Name. Only applicable when dual protocol is set to NETBIOS.

netBiosName.description: NetBIOS Domain. Only applicable when dual protocol set to NETBIOS.

tombstoned.description: 1 indicates that this is a tombstoned external record. 0 indicates that it is not a tombstoned external record.

externalComment.description: text (up to 255 characters), a comment indicating the history of this external add.

manualFlag.description: Determines whether MACAddress/ClientID is set based on its value. If value is 0, MACAddress is set, if value is 1, ClientID is set.

publishA.description: A resource record option (Always | None | Push Only).

publishPTR.description: PTR resource record option (Always | None | Push Only).

role.description:
Primary/Secondary DNS Server:
With P is for Primary and S is for Secondary

secureUpdate.description: 1 is turn on the flag of sending secure update 0 is not

DNSZoneRec.description:
This section defines a group of operations for adding a global zone. Different messages, 
and capabilities, are provided to handle the adding. Add, Get and Update actions support 
are supported.

newName.description: New name of the zone. This is used for updating a new name for a zone.

parentAddress.description: Parent address of the splitted reverse zone.

networkAddress.description: Network address of the reverse zone.

minPrefix.description: Smallest block that can be assigned

maxPrefix.description: Largest block that can be assigned

defaultPrefix.description: Default size of the block assigned

createType.description: Keep value as 1 which refers to user initiated operation. It's required when create a V6Block

createReverseZone.description: true for create V6 Reverse Zone and vice versa (default is true).

assignAlgorithm.description: Assignment algorithm used in the block.

createReverseZone.description: true for create V6 Reverse Zone and vice versa (default is false). Support both quotation marks and non-quotation marks

name.description:
Name of the pool.
You should not enter a pool name with the last character is \ 

This will make the parent pool name get parsed incorrectly.

newName.description: Name of the pool - support change name of pool.

fullQualifiedParentPoolName.description: full Qualified Parent name of Pool

parentName.description:
Name of parent pool.
If you want the / character to be a part of the pool name, it must be escaped using slash \ character.

minPrefix.description: Smallest block that can be assigned

maxPrefix.description: Largest block that can be assigned

defaultPrefix.description: Default size of the block assigned

createReverseZone.description: true for create V6 Reverse Zone and vice versa (default is false).

alertType.description:
A alert type

DNS TUNNELS: messages about DNS TUNNELS attacks

DNS DDOS: messages about DNS DDOS attacks

DNS SUBDOMAIN DDOS: messages about DNS SubDomain DDoS attacks

DNS REFLECTION AND AMPLIFICATION: messages about DNS REFLECTION AND AMPLIFICATION attacks

severity.description:
Severity type

CRITICAL: critical problem messages.

WARNING: warning problem messages.

INFO: information messages.

example.alertContent:
DDI DDoS Detection
The VitalQIP DDI Analytics server detected an abnormally high DNS query rate that exceeds the configured threshold for the DNS server on 2016-10-20T03:44:21.256001Z.
If desired, information on DNS queries can be obtained from the following sites:
DNS Top Clients:
http://192.168.88.175:5601/app/kibana#/visualize/edit/DNS-Top-Clients-IN
Top-Clients-IN
DNS Top Requested Domain Names:
http://192.168.88.175:5601/app/kibana#/visualize/edit/DNS-Top-Requested-Domain-Names-IN
DNS Top Requested Record Types:
http://192.168.88.175:5601/app/kibana#/visualize/edit/DNS-Top-Requested-Record-Types-IN
To mitigate a DDoS attack, an administrator may want to configure Response Rate

runMode.description:
IN_FOREGROUND: run the job immediately.

IN_BACKGROUND: run the job in background.

SCHEDULED_AT: run the job for later.

The default value is IN_FOREGROUND for server push and IN_BACKGROUND for preview push.

scheduledTime.description: Specify a date and time run the push, support the following date formats: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ; MM/dd/yyyy hh:mm; EEE, yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm; yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm z; yyyyMMdd'T'hhmmZ; yyyy-MM-dd h:mma; MMM d HH:mm yyyy; EEE MMM d HH:mm:ss zzz yyyy

sendEmail.description: If the value is set to true then an email to be send when the job completed, it will require an email address is exist in toEmail field. The default is false.

toEmail.description: An email address of up to 255 characters. Multiple email addresses must be separated by a comma (,).

ccEmail.description: An email address of up to 255 characters. Multiple email addresses must be separated by a comma (,).

adminName.description: Filters on which the user's jobs are displayed. This field is disabled if the user is not a master or organization administrator, since normal administrator may only view.

status.description: The status of the job scheduler. Valid values are: Running, Pending, Delayed, Scheduled, Completed, Failed, Cancelled.

server.description: Name of the server to which the scheduled job is assigned.

scheduledTime.description: Jobs that are scheduled or started after a specified date and time, support the following date format: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm z

startTime.description: Jobs that are started in a specified date and time, support the following date format: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm z

completedTime.description: Jobs that are completed in a specified date and time, support the following date format: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm z
